description: Borrowed from French hectare, formed from Ancient Greek ἑκατόν (hekatón, “hundred”) + are.

entries.meaning: A unit of surface area (symbol ha) equal to 100 ares (that is, 10,000 square metres, one hundredth of a square kilometre, or approximately 2.5 acres), used for measuring the areas of geographical features such as land and bodies of water.
